attributes.action: Re-establish  the  10 % tax band and stop changes which affect the worse off .i.e. the low paid and pensioners
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The government is asking the lowliest paid and pensioners of the UK to cough up another £3.5 Billion pounds. While the lowly paid and pensioners tend to get very low if any increases in their incomes, it is this part of the UK which Mr Brown decided to squeeze for more money! It's easy to wonder what all the fuss is about when your on more than £61,000 a year as an MP plus upwards of another £90,000 in allowances but the UKs pensioners and lowly paid cannot even dream of these types of incomes. I ask the Prime Minister and The Chancellor to “Stop taxing the poor of the UK” and show some sensitivity to the population of the UK.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
